title: Abbey-Leigh Stringer
text:
Abbey-Leigh Stringer (born 17 May 1995) is an English <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who plays for <a href="West%20Ham%20United%20W.F.C.">West Ham United</a> in the <a href="FA%20Women%27s%20Super%20League">FA Women's Super League</a>.
Career.
Youth.
Stringer spent her youth development with <a href="Aston%20Villa%20L.F.C.">Aston Villa's</a> center of excellence. Her performances and development there earned her call-ups for England's youth national teams at various levels.
Club.
Birmingham City.
In June 2014, Stringer signed with <a href="FA%20Women%27s%20Super%20League">WSL 1</a> side and cross-town rivals, <a href="Birmingham%20City%20W.F.C.">Birmingham City</a> After limited appearances for Birmingham, she was loaned back to <a href="Aston%20Villa%20L.F.C.">Aston Villa</a> in July 2015 to gain more experience and develop her skills.
At the conclusion of her loan spell, she returned to Birmingham and signed a professional deal in January 2016. During her time with Birmingham she would make 37 league appearances, 6 WSL Cup appearances, and help the Blues finish as runners up in the <a href="2016%20FA%20WSL%23WSL%20Cup">2016 WSL Cup</a> and the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20FA%20Women%27s%20Cup">2016–17 FA Women's Cup</a>.
Everton.
In August 2018, Stringer signed for <a href="Everton%20L.F.C.">Everton L.F.C.</a>.
International.
Stringer has made appearances for various youth levels of the <a href="England%20women%27s%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">England national team</a> from U-17s through U-23s. She contributed 2 starts and 3 appearances for England during their runner-up finish in the <a href="2013%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Under-19%20Championship">2013 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship</a>.
